tldr: The article is an obituary for Charles William Siemens, a prominent engineer and inventor. Born in Hanover, Siemens studied at the Polytechnic School of Magdeburg and the University of Göttingen. He made significant contributions to electro-gilding, the chronometric governor, anastatic printing, and the water-meter. His work in thermodynamics, particularly the regenerative principle, led to improvements in steam-engine efficiency. Siemens was also a strong advocate for smoke abatement and had plans to create a smokeless method of supplying heat to steam boilers.
